intro: Bravoa platyphylla, commonly known as the flatleaf bravoa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous stem and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright pink or red blooms during the summer months. Its leaves are broad, fleshy, and often form a rosette at the base. Bravoa platyphylla is well-suited for rock gardens and containers due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
